title: Subhead - Absolut Vodka
content:
Hi everbody.

Do anybody knows the name of this handwrittten font?  
It is the font of absolut vodka.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605054722im_/http:/typophile.com/files/vodka.jpg)

thanks a lot

lecker

 [‹ grid-like tech sans taken from EmeryFrost website](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605054722/http:/typophile.com/node/16113 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) France Bleu Roussillon logo - ITC Franklin Gothic {Tiff, Mark S} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605054722/http:/typophile.com/node/16111 "Go to next forum topic")
author: lecker

comments.content: Do you happen to have a sample you can post?

I can see it. For some reason, it takes long to load. (I don’t know what it is, though.)

Edit: It’s 572k. That could explain it.

Further edit: I can’t explain why the file is 572k. Photoshop shows it as being only 48k when you open it. Also, it is a CMYK jpeg, which some browsers can’t (won’t?) display.

I remember seeing that font, and the closest I could come to was Shelly Volante, Adobe, on the Mac

or HogarthScrD Regular on the PC

**It was originally hand drawn by Kotte (**Cone**) Jönsson.  
Read more [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605054722/http:/home.swipnet.se/~w-33318/websolut/webtext.htm) about that polished turd of alcohols.**

ƒ

thnx a lot for the answers.  
... CMYK - typical for me (posting before thinking)  
tsts

\> “xerox-copy to make it look more handmade.”

That’s the funniest thing I’ll read today (and it’s not even noon).

hhp

\> “xerox-copy to make it look more handmade.”

Kinda like OTF handwriting scripts today using salts to make them look hand written :-)

ChrisL
